items.title: Malawi’s 85-year-old ex-leader returns to power in presidential election
bullets: • Peter Mutharika got 56.8% of the vote compared with 33% for Lazarus Chakwera
• The 85-year-old former leader presided over a multi-year economic crisis, high inflation, essential goods shortages, climate disasters and international aid cuts

items.title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in jail but with head held high’ after conviction
bullets: • First time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history

• Sentence follows trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign

items.title: Zelensky condemns 'vile' Russian strikes lasting 12 hours
bullets: • Nearly 600 drones and several dozen missiles fired at seven regions of Ukraine
• President Volodymyr Zelensky condemns 'vile' attack and says Ukraine will retaliate
• Russia said it struck military facilities and industrial enterprises supporting Ukraine's armed forces

items.title: Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco
bullets: • Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco in a ceremony in California
• The couple exchanged vows in Santa Barbara on Saturday in front of around 170 guests, including Taylor Swift, Paul Rudd, Steve Martin and Martin Short
• Gomez posted pictures to Instagram of her and Blanco on Saturday

items.title: Sanctions reimposed on Iran 10 years after landmark nuclear deal
bullets: • Sanctions reimposed on Iran 10 years after landmark nuclear deal
• UK, France and Germany activate the so-called "snapback" mechanism
• Iran suspended inspections of its nuclear facilities after Israel and US bombed them in June
• President Masoud Pezeshkian insists Iran has no intention of developing nuclear weapons

items.title: A new buzzword is hanging over businesses as they rush into AI
bullets: • 79% of companies globally expect to incur an "AI debt" as a result of poorly implemented autonomous tools, according to a new report by Asana on the State of AI at Work
• The debt could manifest as security risks, poor data quality, low impact AI agents, and a management skills gap

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: DACA has bipartisan support in Congress. Still, Republicans are following Trump's lead
bullets: • Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program created in 2012 to protect children from deportation
• Republican lawmakers are open to a permanent solution to the problem
• Nearly 20 DACA recipients have been caught in the cross-fire of the program this year
• The program has bipartisan support in Congress

items.title: Why friends are teaming up to buy homes
bullets: • Housing prices are up 56% since February 2020, according to data from the National Association of Realtors
• Hayley Currier and Tammy Kremer are longtime friends who bonded over their mutual passions for open-water swimming, Jewish rituals and political organizing

items.title: Large Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10
bullets: • Large Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10 people
• A 12-year-old girl was among the dead, head of the Kyiv City Administration says
• First major bombardment since 21 killed at least 21 people last month
• Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says attack involved "nearly 500 strike drones and more than 40 missiles"

items.title: Argentines demand justice at protest against brutal killings of young women
bullets: • Two girls and two women were found dead in Buenos Aires last week
• Police say they were part of a drug-related plot to 'punish' the victims
• A video of the incident shows the victims being attacked by a gang
• The bodies of the victims were found five days after the attack

items.title: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
bullets: • At least 36 people are killed in a stampede at a rally in India
• The victims were trying to get close to the stage
• The incident occurred during a speech by Vijay Patel
• The crowd began to fall in the middle of the rally

items.title: Autism may be the price of human intelligence
bullets: • Specific neurons in the outer brain evolved rapidly, and autism-linked genes changed under natural selection
• These shifts may have slowed brain development in children while boosting language and cognition
• Globally, the World Health Organization estimates that around one in 100 children have autism

items.title: UN imposes 'snapback' sanctions on a hungrier, poorer and more anxious Iran
bullets: • UN imposes 'snapback' sanctions on a hungrier, poorer and more anxious Iran
• The sanctions come via a mechanism known as "snapback" included in Iran's 2015 nuclear deal with world powers
• Iran's rial currency sits at a record low, increasing pressure on food prices

items.title: Trump news at a glance: Trump orders deployment of national guard to ‘war ravaged’ Portland
bullets: • Donald Trump orders deployment of national guard to ‘war ravaged’ Portland
• Officials in Portland have pushed back against the announcement, saying there is ‘no need for military troops’ – key US politics stories from Saturday 27 September

items.title: Four strange secrets scientists just found in beer and wine
bullets: • Recent research highlights how yeast extracts can cloud lagers, gluten can be quickly detected with a simple test strip
• Tannins give red wine its lip-puckering edge, and sulfites alter gut bacteria in unexpected ways
• These discoveries not only deepen our understanding of these drinks’ sensory qualities but also hint at implications for health and brewing innovation

items.title: Hidden Alzheimer’s warning signs found in Parkinson’s patients without dementia
bullets: • Researchers in Japan found Parkinson's patients diagnosed in their 80s are far more likely to show signs of amyloid buildup, a hallmark of Alzheimer's, even without dementia symptoms
• The study compared younger and older patients, finding that older individuals had three times the rate of amyoid positivity
• Surprisingly, Parkinson’s patients overall showed lower levels of buildup than healthy people

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: Portland residents scoff at Trump threat to send military: ‘This is not a war zone’
bullets: • Donald Trump falsely declared Portland, Oregon, ‘war ravaged’ by antifascists and “other domestic terrorists” The US president’s impression of the city, apparently shaped by misleading conservative media reports, is entirely divorced from reality
• There were just four protesters outside the Immigration and Customs Enforcement field office

items.title: Trump authorises 'full force' as Portland becomes latest city to see troops deployed
bullets: • Trump orders deployment of troops to Portland, Oregon, authorising use of 'full force' to suppress protests
• Move is part of wider crackdown on illegal immigration
• Democratic lawmakers say there is no need for federal troops to be deployed to the city

items.title: Marc Maron, Human Rights Watch and others slam Saudi comedy festival
bullets: • Saudi Arabia is hosting the first ever Riyadh Comedy Festival through Oct
• The participation of big-name funnymen, including Dave Chappelle, Aziz Ansari, Kevin Hart and Jimmy Carr, has provoked criticism
• Marc Maron, Shane Gillis and Stavros Halkias have criticized the festival
• Human Rights Watch: Saudi government is using the festival to deflect attention from repression

items.title: President Trump posts cartoon image depicting him firing Fed Chief Powell
bullets: • President Donald Trump posted a cartoon image of himself firing Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell
• The image appears to be "AI-generated or digitally illustrated," according to visual analysis
• Trump has repeatedly criticized Powell for his cautious approach to cutting interest rates, nicknaming him "Too Late Powell"

items.title: Three dead in Arizona flooding as the Carolinas brace for possible hurricane
bullets: • At least three people died and others were believed missing after flooding in a rural community in Arizona
• Searchers looked for people missing all night, and more help arrived on Saturday to continue the search
• North Carolina’s governor, Josh Stein, declared a state of emergency in advance of the system that is being identified by the National Hurricane Center in Miami as Tropical Depression Nine

items.title: NoViolet Bulawayo wins the Best of Caine award
bullets: • Best of Caine Prize for African Writing is awarded for a short story
• The story examines the lives of a group of children in Budapest, Hungary
• The winner of the award will be announced at the end of the month
• The award was handed out at the British Library in London today

items.title: Trump is flaunting his corruption. Is it changing what the US thinks of scandal?
bullets: • US president’s determination to break from his predecessors includes willingness to shout from rooftops of misconduct past presidents would have strained every sinew to conceal
• Brazen approach earns him perverse credit for authenticity and takes sting out of scandals that used to be career-ending

items.title: FBI arrest man who allegedly threatened to shoot people at Texas Pride parade
bullets: • Joshua Cole allegedly threatened to shoot people at a pro-LGBTQ+ parade in Abilene, Texas, to avenge the murder of Charlie Kirk
• Cole allegedly used a Facebook account under the name “Jay Dubya” where he “threatened to commit a shooting” at a Pride parade on 20 September

items.title: How a 'nudify' site turned a group of friends into key figures in a fight against AI-generated porn
bullets: • Jessica Guistolise received a text message from an acquaintance who said she had urgent information to share about her estranged husband, Ben
• Jenny told her she'd found pictures on Ben's computer of more than 80 women whose social media photos were used to create deepfake pornography
• Most of the women in Ben's images lived in the Minneapolis area

items.title: Southeast U.S. braces for heavy rains from a potential tropical storm
bullets: • Southeast U.S
• braces for heavy rains from a potential tropical storm
• Tropical Depression 9 is expected to make landfall early next week
• South Carolina Gov
• Henry McMaster put residents under a state of emergency in preparation

items.title: The resilient stock market may be keeping the economy out of a recession. Why that's a bad thing
bullets: • Economic data this week painted a surprisingly bright picture of recent trends
• Consumer spending in August was stronger than expected and income was higher than expected
• The narrative now is shifting towards the ever-popular wealth effect coming from Wall Street and a succession of new highs in major stock indexes

items.title: Cocoa supplements show surprising anti-aging potential
bullets: • Daily cocoa extract supplements reduced key inflammation markers in older adults, pointing to a role in protecting the heart
• Cocoa extract has been shown in previous, smaller studies to reduce inflammatory biomarkers
• The findings reinforce the value of flavanol-rich, plant-based foods for healthier aging

items.title: 'Seconds count': Avoiding airplane collisions at airports could come down to cockpit alerts
bullets: • Honeywell test pilot recreates some of the most serious near disasters at airports in recent aviation history
• The National Transportation Safety Board and other safety experts have urged more advanced cockpit alerts
• Runway incursions, when a plane, person or vehicle is on the runway when they shouldn't be, averaged 4.5 a day last year

items.title: How the brain decides which moments you’ll never forget
bullets: • BU study finds memories of mundane incidents can be strengthened when they get attached to a memory of an emotionally charged event
• This could help explain why we recall certain details surrounding big events and may lead to new ways of boosting learning and treating memory disorders
• The findings, published in Science Advances, could potentially lead to improved treatments

items.title: The current war on science, and who’s behind it
bullets: • Michael Mann is a climate scientist at the University of Pennsylvania who, in 1998, developed the notorious hockey stick graph
• Peter Hotez is a microbiologist and pediatrician at Baylor College of Medicine whose group developed a low-cost, patent-free vaccine using public funds

items.title: Why LA Comic Con thought making an AI-powered Stan Lee hologram was a good idea
bullets: • A "AI Stan Lee hologram" will be appearing at the LA Comic Con this weekend
• Fans will be able to pay $15 to $20 to see the AI-powered avatar of Lee in an enclosed booth at the show
• The instant response from many fans and media outlets to the idea was not kind
• The CEO of the parent company behind the event urged critics to come see the hologram for themselves

items.title: ‘A donkey cart out of El Fasher costs more than a new car’: how 500 days under siege is tearing the city apart
bullets: • El Fasher, North Darfur’s capital, has been trapped in one of the longest urban sieges of modern warfare
• The siege, progressively tightened by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), has transformed the city
• Civilians move block by block in search of safety, while self-defence groups fight alongside entrenched garrisons

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: Can AI detect hedgehogs from space? Maybe if you find brambles first.
bullets: • Scientists are using satellite imagery and AI models to map hedgehog habitats across the UK
• European hedgehog populations have declined by roughly 30 to 50 percent over the past decade
• Traditional hedgehog surveys require nighttime fieldwork, specialized equipment, or citizen scientists reporting sightings

items.title: Woman hospitalized with pain and vomiting—diet soda cured her
bullets: • A 63-year-old woman showed up at the emergency department of the Brigham and Women’s Hospital in Boston with severe stomach pain, nausea, and vomiting
• The doctors started doing lab tests and imaging, and they admitted her to the hospital
• They found bile duct enlargement and a swollen stomach that seemed to be full of a semi-solid mass

items.title: LG’s $1,800 TV for seniors makes misguided assumptions
bullets: • LG announced the Easy TV in South Korea, aiming it at the “senior TV market
• One of the features that LG has included in attempts to appeal to this demographic is a remote control with numbers
• The Easy TV’s remote has all of those buttons, plus mute, zoom, and bigger labels

items.title: World must deny Israel ‘tools of genocide’, says growing alliance of activist states
bullets: • Malaysian foreign minister Mohamad Hasan said the international community has a legal and moral duty to deny Israel ‘the tools of genocide’ The Hague Group is a growing alliance of countries dedicated to coordinating practical economic and legal steps to isolate Israel over the war in Gaza

items.title: 'Long history of blaming mothers': Trump's Tylenol warning echoes past misconceptions
bullets: • President Trump urged pregnant women to "tough it out" and take Tylenol sparingly
• Medical experts have strongly pushed back on the guidance, arguing that such claims are misleading
• The Food and Drug Administration later clarified that "while an association between acetaminophen and autism has been described in many studies"

items.title: Martin Shkreli can be sued for copying Wu-Tang’s one-of-a-kind record
bullets: • Martin Shkreli will have to face a lawsuit for making copies of the Wu-Tang Clan’s Once Upon a Time in Shaolin
• US District Judge Pamela Chen dismissed some claims by the album's current owners, PleasrDAO, but will allow the suit alleging “misappropriation of trade secrets to continue

items.title: Switch 2 controllers and the OnePlus Watch 3 top our list of the best deals this week
bullets: • Nintendo’s first-party Switch 2 Pro Controller can’t be beaten when it comes to its breadth of features and comfort
• Thankfully, a controller I’ve been testing recently, which is nearly as good despite lacking a 3.5mm audio jack, is currently on sale for $40 less
• The EasySMX S10 is comfortable to use for long gaming sessions, and it has features that aren't commonly built into third-party gamepads

items.title: The strangest game of the year is a channel-surfing simulator
bullets: • The idea is that, for reasons that aren’t immediately clear, you’re able to tune into a TV network from another world, the titular Blippo Plus
• There are FMV shows with human actors, covering everything from dramas to cooking
• At various points, you'll have to adjust the picture so you can see things clearly

items.title: Can Google be trusted without a break up?
bullets: • Can Google be trusted without a break-up? The DOJ argues as long as Google still has the means and incentives to accrue dominance, the DOJ argues
• Google employees allegedly used chat messages to avoid leaving a paper trail for discovery
• Google’s remedies proposal involves a court order banning specific busin

items.title: When this EV maker collapsed, its customers became the car company
bullets: • Fisker Ocean owners are fighting to keep their EVs alive after the company’s bankruptcy
• Thousands of Ocean owners have organized into their own makeshift car company
• The Fiskers Owners Association (FOA) is a nonprofit that's launched third-party apps, built a global parts supply chain, and came together around a future for orphaned vehicles

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN
